slides.title: What is Global Warming?
slides.content: Global warming refers to the long-term heating of Earth's climate system observed since the pre-industrial period (between 1850 and 1900) due to human activities, primarily fossil fuel burning, which increases heat-trapping greenhouse gas levels in Earth’s atmosphere.
slides.notes: Explain the basic science behind global warming. Emphasize the role of greenhouse gases and human activities.

elements.description: Arrow pointing upwards with increasing temperature indicators to visualize the warming trend.
Use a background image of Earth with a subtle heat map overlay.

slides.title: Causes of Global Warming
slides.content:
- Burning Fossil Fuels (Coal, Oil, Gas)
- Deforestation
- Industrial Processes
- Agriculture (Methane emissions)
slides.notes: Detail the main anthropogenic sources of greenhouse gas emissions. Explain how each activity contributes to the problem.

elements.description: Series of interconnected circles representing different causes, with arrows showing their combined impact on global warming.
Use icons next to each bullet point to visually represent the cause (e.g., a factory for industrial processes, a tree being cut down for deforestation).
Use a 'Wipe' transition to gradually reveal each cause.

slides.title: Impacts of Global Warming
slides.content:
- Rising Sea Levels
- Extreme Weather Events (Hurricanes, Droughts, Floods)
- Melting Glaciers and Ice Sheets
- Disruption of Ecosystems
- Threats to Human Health
slides.notes: Describe the devastating consequences of global warming on the environment and human society. Use impactful visuals to illustrate these effects.

elements.description: A wave graphic gradually rising to symbolize rising sea levels.
Use a split-screen design, showing a healthy ecosystem on one side and a damaged ecosystem on the other.
Use a 'Fade' transition to highlight the devastating impacts.

slides.title: Solutions to Global Warming
slides.content:
- Transition to Renewable Energy (Solar, Wind, Hydro)
- Improve Energy Efficiency
- Sustainable Transportation (Electric Vehicles, Public Transit)
- Reforestation and Afforestation
- Carbon Capture Technologies
slides.notes: Present viable solutions to mitigate global warming. Emphasize the importance of individual and collective action.

elements.description: A stylized sun and wind turbine icon to represent renewable energy.
Use a positive color palette (greens and blues) to create a hopeful and optimistic tone.
Use a 'Morph' transition to show the transformation from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources.
